newsitem.title: USA: Sun Micro cuts some server prices.
newsitem.headline: Sun Micro cuts some server prices.

text.p: Sun Microsystems Inc said Tuesday it cut prices of some of its servers -- the computers that control a network -- by up to 27 percent, following recent price cuts by its rivals.
The maker of powerful desktop computers and servers said the starting price of its Ultra Enterprise 3000 server is now $43,250. It did not give the previous price.
Sun also put networking features found in its more expensive machines into the departmental servers, the company said.

Sun's price cuts come during a week when its competitors -- including Tandem Computers Inc, Compaq Computer Corp and International Business Machines Corp -- are expected to unveil new products or cheaper server offerings based on the Windows NT software standard.

Sun's machines are used to control the flow of information between hundreds of PCs in small corporate or departmental networks. The company is facing increasingly stiff competition based on cheaper software and chip technology from Microsoft Corp and Intel Corp.
